thread.title: Beyoncé wins plagiarism lawsuit after a singer claimed she stole his music for 'XO' - Music
thread.title_full: Beyoncé wins plagiarism lawsuit after a singer claimed she stole his music for 'XO' - Music News - Digital Spy

author: Tasha Hegarty
title: Beyoncé wins plagiarism lawsuit after a singer claimed she stole his music for 'XO' - Music
text: Beyoncé has proved she's still Queen B after coming out on top in a plagiarism lawsuit.Ahmad 'Javon' Lane previously sued Beyoncé for $7 million, claiming she stole his music for her track 'XO' after he apparently passed his song to one of her backing singers to listen to. © Jamie McCarthy/Getty Images for TIDAL However, the judge threw the case out after ruling that his track 'XOXO' contained no discernible resemblance to the singer's hit, according to TMZ.Her attorney said in the court documents that there was no "melodic content and there is no meaningful similarity in pitch series, rhythm or rhythmic patterns, melodic development or structure" in the two tracks.It was also noted that the songs have completely different themes, with Lane's track featuring far more sexual lyrics.It's not the first time the singer has been sued for plagiarism. In 2014, Hungarian singer Monika Miczura Juhász accused Beyoncé, Jay Z and Timbaland of sampling her voice in 'Drunk in Love'. Watch the video for 'XO' below:
